commentary: Bracewell to Gunathilaka, no run presents one just back of a length on middle and off, Danushka gets up as tall as he can to gently knock it into the covers
text: presents one just back of a length on middle and off, Danushka gets up as tall as he can to gently knock it into the covers

commentary: Bracewell to Gunathilaka, no run 'yes, yes, yes,' says Danuskha but be can't convince his senior partner for a single. Dilshan is sprightly even at 39, but with McCullum coming in from mid-off, discretion is the better part of valour.
text: 'yes, yes, yes,' says Danuskha but be can't convince his senior partner for a single. Dilshan is sprightly even at 39, but with McCullum coming in from mid-off, discretion is the better part of valour.

commentary: Bracewell to Gunathilaka, no run just back of a good length and outside off, no shot offered
text: just back of a good length and outside off, no shot offered

commentary: Bracewell to Gunathilaka, no run another teaser outside off, but since it is not all that full, the batsman gets a nice sighter and leaves it
text: another teaser outside off, but since it is not all that full, the batsman gets a nice sighter and leaves it

commentary: Bracewell to Gunathilaka, no run explores a fuller length outside off, eased to point
text: explores a fuller length outside off, eased to point

commentary: Bracewell to Gunathilaka, no run good length ball on off stump, defended in front of the wicket

commentary: Henry to Dilshan, no run provides a nice push to mid-off
text: provides a nice push to mid-off

commentary: Henry to Dilshan, no run fullish on middle, with just a little shape away. Dilshan covers it with a straight bat. Oh, but we won't be seeing that anymore. The back of the bat seems to have cracked and Dilshan asks for a replacement
text: fullish on middle, with just a little shape away. Dilshan covers it with a straight bat. Oh, but we won't be seeing that anymore. The back of the bat seems to have cracked and Dilshan asks for a replacement

commentary: Henry to Dilshan, no run back of a length and outside off, opens the face of the bat and guides to point
text: back of a length and outside off, opens the face of the bat and guides to point

commentary: Henry to Dilshan, no run this time he gets the ball to dart back into the right-hander, who is not quite ready for it. Late to adjust to it as he tries to flick off the front foot. Beaten, and struck high on the back leg
text: this time he gets the ball to dart back into the right-hander, who is not quite ready for it. Late to adjust to it as he tries to flick off the front foot. Beaten, and struck high on the back leg

commentary: Henry to Dilshan, no run nudged away towards square leg, the indipper again, and again the shot was not too convincing
text: nudged away towards square leg, the indipper again, and again the shot was not too convincing

commentary: Henry to Dilshan, 4 leg byes gets some healthy bounce, but he is a touch too straight. Dilshan goes for the leg glance, but only gets a smidge of the trouser on it. Four leg byes
text: gets some healthy bounce, but he is a touch too straight. Dilshan goes for the leg glance, but only gets a smidge of the trouser on it. Four leg byes

commentary: Bracewell to Gunathilaka, 3 runs stands up tall and punches the short of a length delivery through the covers. Santner was the man prowling that area, and he may have got a bad bounce to let the ball right through him
text: stands up tall and punches the short of a length delivery through the covers. Santner was the man prowling that area, and he may have got a bad bounce to let the ball right through him

commentary: Bracewell to Dilshan, no run driven down the ground, and although he did look to play authoritatively, the shot has been mistimed. Henry gets down to it in time to stop any runs
text: driven down the ground, and although he did look to play authoritatively, the shot has been mistimed. Henry gets down to it in time to stop any runs

commentary: Bracewell to Dilshan, FOUR runs that's brilliant! That's pure instinct! This is a pretty decent delivery - full on off stump - but Dilshan drags it away to the square leg boundary
text: that's brilliant! That's pure instinct! This is a pretty decent delivery - full on off stump - but Dilshan drags it away to the square leg boundary

commentary: Bracewell to Dilshan, 3 runs advances on the bowler, no turning back for Dilshan! The bowler digs it in shorter and it has been whipped away towards the long leg boundary. Henry is the man hunting it down, puts in a big dive but the ball still rolls on towards the advertising triangles. So Henry has to put in a second dive, and just about keeps it inside

Henry is the man hunting it down, puts in a big dive but the ball still rolls on towards the advertising triangles. So Henry has to put in a second dive, and just about keeps it inside

commentary: Bracewell to Gunathilaka, no run short of a good length again, blocked into the off side
text: short of a good length again, blocked into the off side

commentary: Bracewell to Gunathilaka, 1 run banged quite hard into the middle of the deck, Danushka goes for a pull but hasn't put everything behind it. A little slow on it, perhaps
text: banged quite hard into the middle of the deck, Danushka goes for a pull but hasn't put everything behind it. A little slow on it, perhaps

commentary: Henry to Gunathilaka, FOUR runs gorgeous hit, as they are when they go down the ground! Saw the ball full on off stump and backed himself.
text: gorgeous hit, as they are when they go down the ground! Saw the ball full on off stump and backed himself.

commentary: Henry to Gunathilaka, no run lines up a short ball quickly enough and heaves it to short midwicket. A few yards either side and that would have been four too
text: lines up a short ball quickly enough and heaves it to short midwicket. A few yards either side and that would have been four too

commentary: Henry to Gunathilaka, 1 run outside edge, as he repeats an on the up drive. The target area was mid-off, but it ends up lost at deep third man
text: outside edge, as he repeats an on the up drive. The target area was mid-off, but it ends up lost at deep third man

commentary: Henry to Dilshan, no run another inswinger from Henry, full and fast to have Dilshan falling over at the crease. Would have slid down leg though
text: another inswinger from Henry, full and fast to have Dilshan falling over at the crease. Would have slid down leg though

commentary: Henry to Dilshan, OUT oh my word! He jumped down the pitch, but then decided he didn't want play. That's credit to Henry for bowling the ball shorter, and getting it to zip back into the batsman. Takes the face of the bat even as Dilshan tries to hide it behind his body and it ends up caught at first slip!
text: oh my word! He jumped down the pitch, but then decided he didn't want play. That's credit to Henry for bowling the ball shorter, and getting it to zip back into the batsman. Takes the face of the bat even as Dilshan tries to hide it behind his body and it ends up caught at first slip!

commentary: Henry to Thirimanne, no run pats it into the covers
text: pats it into the covers

commentary: McClenaghan to Gunathilaka, no run lovely little intro. Hi, I'm going to hit the deck, pin you on the back foot and rip the ball past the outside edge. Have fun.
text: lovely little intro. Hi, I'm going to hit the deck, pin you on the back foot and rip the ball past the outside edge. Have fun.

commentary: McClenaghan to Gunathilaka, no run gets the ball to hit the splice of the bat, with Danushka stood firmly deep in his crease. Pushed towards point
text: gets the ball to hit the splice of the bat, with Danushka stood firmly deep in his crease. Pushed towards point

commentary: McClenaghan to Gunathilaka, no run back of a length on off stump, guided towards point again
text: back of a length on off stump, guided towards point again

commentary: McClenaghan to Gunathilaka, no run the sticker of the bat is getting some good coverage here on the replays. McClenaghan bangs it in and gets it to rise towards the ribs. Nudged to the left of the slips
text: the sticker of the bat is getting some good coverage here on the replays. McClenaghan bangs it in and gets it to rise towards the ribs. Nudged to the left of the slips

commentary: McClenaghan to Gunathilaka, FOUR runs launched down the ground! The first sign of the ball being full and Danushka gives it the big golf swing. Solid front foot stride, booming intent, and he has got just enough on it to soar over Bracewell at mid-on and beat his dive on the boundary too

commentary: McClenaghan to Gunathilaka, no run full on middle, Danushka works it towards midwicket
text: full on middle, Danushka works it towards midwicket

commentary: Henry to Thirimanne, 1 run massive effort at point from Guptill! Flew to his left, and parries it with one hand to his colleage at cover. Wonderfully timed, and well controlled dab from Thirimanne ends up with only one
text: massive effort at point from Guptill! Flew to his left, and parries it with one hand to his colleage at cover. Wonderfully timed, and well controlled dab from Thirimanne ends up with only one

commentary: Henry to Gunathilaka, no run rapid! That's a 140 kph bouncer! Danushka does well by dropping his wrists and swaying away from the line. Right over off stump, it was too
text: rapid! That's a 140 kph bouncer! Danushka does well by dropping his wrists and swaying away from the line. Right over off stump, it was too

commentary: Henry to Gunathilaka, FOUR runs he is always on the lookout for the chip over the infield. A fuller length helps and he has a very good eye, it seems. Picks it up early and trusts his power. The bat turns in his hand, but it still had enough on it to beat McCullum running back from mid-off

text: fuller delivery on off stump, pushed into the covers

commentary: Henry to Gunathilaka, no run that time he is unable to work the drive. Henry held it back just enough that it can kiss the pitch and zip past the outside edge of the bat, and not be crunched by the middle

commentary: McClenaghan to Thirimanne, no run gets it to duck back into the left-hander, and Thirimanne, expecting the outsswinger, is very late on it. Gets only an inside edge onto his body

text: just back of a good length and on a fourth stump line, defended

commentary: McClenaghan to Thirimanne, OUT slashed high, but not long enough! Thirimanne is appalled at giving it away so easily. The ball was short, it had enough width too. Out came the upper cut, which just drops down the throat of Henry at deep third man

commentary: McClenaghan to Chandimal, no run
McClenaghan to Chandimal, no run fuller delivery on off stump, driven to mid-on

commentary: Henry to Gunathilaka, no run beautiful bowling from Henry. Starts the awayswinger on middle and leg and gets some assistance off the deck as well. Danushka presses forward with hard hands and gets an edge. Falls short of third slip though. Latham did his best, diving low to his right
text: beautiful bowling from Henry. Starts the awayswinger on middle and leg and gets some assistance off the deck as well. Danushka presses forward with hard hands and gets an edge. Falls short of third slip though. Latham did his best, diving low to his right

commentary: Henry to Gunathilaka, OUT what a ripper! Santner threw himself to his left at cover, thuds into the lush green Hagley Oval outfield and comes up with a superb catch. Had his eyes on the prize all the way. It was a fuller ball that tempted the batsman on the drive again. Danushka has not been very keen to keep the ball down and this time Santner's brilliance - he took it with both hands - makes him pay
text: what a ripper! Santner threw himself to his left at cover, thuds into the lush green Hagley Oval outfield and comes up with a superb catch. Had his eyes on the prize all the way. It was a fuller ball that tempted the batsman on the drive again. Danushka has not been very keen to keep the ball down and this time Santner's brilliance - he took it with both hands - makes him pay

commentary: Henry to Mathews, 1 run back of a length and tucking him up, picked away to long leg
text: back of a length and tucking him up, picked away to long leg

commentary: Henry to Chandimal, no run just back of a good length on off stump, defended. And Chandimal's space is invaded by the three slips, and the point fielder rushing forward
text: just back of a good length on off stump, defended. And Chandimal's space is invaded by the three slips, and the point fielder rushing forward

commentary: Henry to Chandimal, no run full and tailing in on off stump, pushed to mid-on
text: full and tailing in on off stump, pushed to mid-on

commentary: Henry to Chandimal, 1 run direct hit? No and Chandimal can heave a sigh of relief after having to scramble a single. Both batsmen hesitated after a shortish delivery was nudged into the midwicket region. Had they gone straight away, it would have been easy. And once Henry saw the indecision, he raced forward to the ball, whipped around and send a bullet throw too. Just didn't hit the target
text: direct hit? No and Chandimal can heave a sigh of relief after having to scramble a single. Both batsmen hesitated after a shortish delivery was nudged into the midwicket region. Had they gone straight away, it would have been easy. And once Henry saw the indecision, he raced forward to the ball, whipped around and send a bullet throw too. Just didn't hit the target

commentary: McClenaghan to Chandimal, 1 run shortish, but it's misdirected on leg stump, easily worked to long leg
text: shortish, but it's misdirected on leg stump, easily worked to long leg

commentary: McClenaghan to Mathews, no run banged into the middle of the deck at 134 kph, Mathews who was trying to push forward is forced to take evasive action
text: banged into the middle of the deck at 134 kph, Mathews who was trying to push forward is forced to take evasive action

commentary: McClenaghan to Mathews, 3 runs ooooh, Baz throws himself at the ball on the boundary edge and thuds into the advertising hoardings. Poor delivery, half-volley on leg stump, whipped away to deep square leg. McCullum hunted after the ball like it had wronged him, put in the dive, flicked the ball inside and saves a run. But all that effort has meant he has to go off the field to tend to himself. I think it is an issue with his right hand.
text: ooooh, Baz throws himself at the ball on the boundary edge and thuds into the advertising hoardings. Poor delivery, half-volley on leg stump, whipped away to deep square leg. McCullum hunted after the ball like it had wronged him, put in the dive, flicked the ball inside and saves a run. But all that effort has meant he has to go off the field to tend to himself. I think it is an issue with his right hand.

commentary: McClenaghan to Chandimal, 2 runs stands up tall and slams a back of a length delivery off the front foot through point
text: stands up tall and slams a back of a length delivery off the front foot through point

commentary: McClenaghan to Chandimal, no run the captain had gone trekking down the pitch, but Chandimal yells 'NOOOOOO.' Boy, that definitely helped. Defence into the cover region ends up as a dot

commentary: Henry to Mathews, 1 run jumps back in his crease, absorbs all the pace on this back of a length ball on off stump and exploits the gap at midiwcket
text: jumps back in his crease, absorbs all the pace on this back of a length ball on off stump and exploits the gap at midiwcket

commentary: Henry to Chandimal, no run presents the full face to a good length ball on off stump. Lovely strong stride forward as well. Chandimal looking intense.

commentary: Henry to Chandimal, no run drilled back down the ground as he eases into a fuller ball, cannot get it past the bowler though
text: drilled back down the ground as he eases into a fuller ball, cannot get it past the bowler though

commentary: Henry to Chandimal, no run 'No, nooooo!' yells Chandimal again as Mathews charges down for a quick single. No such thing there as the fielder at mid-on races in so quickly

commentary: McClenaghan to Mathews, no run this time its Chandimal's turn to see a single that wasn't there. Mathews turned leg stump into a shiny target as he moved across, McClenaghan went for it with a good length ball on leg stump. Thigh pad gets in the way, and Mathews took a couple of steps down as if he wanted the single but square leg was quick

commentary: McClenaghan to Mathews, FOUR runs fuller and wider outside off, Mathews caresses it down the ground. That's all batsmen need to do. Time the ball and pick the gap instead of losing your head with quick singles
text: fuller and wider outside off, Mathews caresses it down the ground. That's all batsmen need to do. Time the ball and pick the gap instead of losing your head with quick singles

text: good length ball on off stump, defended

commentary: McClenaghan to Mathews, 1 run tickled around the corner as he gets inside the line of a short ball on middle and leg
text: tickled around the corner as he gets inside the line of a short ball on middle and leg

commentary: McClenaghan to Chandimal, no run fuller ball outside off, sweetly hit to cover
text: fuller ball outside off, sweetly hit to cover

commentary: Bracewell to Mathews, FOUR runs su-weeet! I like Mathews' tactics today. Bracewell is not quite the hit the deck bowler, so he is batting outside his crease. This is an even-paced pitch so he is making the ball come onto the bat even more, and it helps when the bowler bowls straight. Flicked away through wide mid-on

commentary: Bracewell to Mathews, no run looks for that gap again, but he hits mid-on

commentary: Bracewell to Mathews, no run jags the ball back and again Mathews is struck on the thigh again. Bracwell has adjusted his line and is started wider of off stump. Mathews is cut in half by the movement back into him, he was only offering an uncertain little waft
text: jags the ball back and again Mathews is struck on the thigh again. Bracwell has adjusted his line and is started wider of off stump. Mathews is cut in half by the movement back into him, he was only offering an uncertain little waft

commentary: Bracewell to Mathews, no run fuller delivery outside off and Mathews throws his bat at it despite being quite stagnant at the crease. Figures I praise him and he goes all lead-footed on me. Beaten on the inside edge again

commentary: Bracewell to Chandimal, no run that's a reminder that Dougie can get it buzzing around the ears too. Digs it in and Chandimal, who was originally looking to pull realises it is a bit too high and pulls out of his shot

commentary: Bracewell to Chandimal, OUT is he in line? Yes. Does he have an inside edge? It appears not. Chandimal walked down to have a chat with his captain, and Mathews sends him on his way just as the umpire did. Bracewell's inswingers have been on the mark, this one began outside off stump, tempting the batsman into thinking it could be driven through the off side. So forward and across came Chandimal and got trapped. His bat was outside the line and couldn't find a way back in time, his front leg was right in line and he was struck on the knee roll
text: is he in line? Yes. Does he have an inside edge? It appears not. Chandimal walked down to have a chat with his captain, and Mathews sends him on his way just as the umpire did. Bracewell's inswingers have been on the mark, this one began outside off stump, tempting the batsman into thinking it could be driven through the off side. So forward and across came Chandimal and got trapped. His bat was outside the line and couldn't find a way back in time, his front leg was right in line and he was struck on the knee roll

commentary: Bracewell to Siriwardana, no run beauty again! He gets it to kick off the pitch and seam away as well. And Siriwardana is new to the crease, so he gets stuck in it. The hands, indicating his nerves, push at the ball and he is beaten

commentary: McClenaghan to Mathews, 1 run gets inside the line of a short ball and clips it to long leg. That back and across movement is very noticeable

commentary: McClenaghan to Siriwardana, 1 run gets up to try and get on top of a short ball just outside off, still doesn't succeed in looking in control. Guided to third man nonetheless

commentary: McClenaghan to Mathews, no run back of a length and just outside off, defused by his feet

commentary: McClenaghan to Mathews, no run eeesh! Mathews was in all sorts of trouble there. With him moving back and across, his ribs are right in the line of fire when the bowler goes for a bouncer on middle. Fends it away, gets a glove towards fine leg

commentary: McClenaghan to Mathews, OUT another bouncer right over middle, another instance of Mathews looking absolutely awkward after moving across outside off. And to make it worse, he has gloved this behind. The Sri Lanka captain was looking to perhaps nudge it around the corner, but there was just a bit more bounce than he liked

The Sri Lanka captain was looking to perhaps nudge it around the corner, but there was just a bit more bounce than he liked

commentary: Bracewell to Siriwardana, FOUR runs good riposte! And he does look like a player who has a lot of shots when the ball is in his half of the pitch. Gets forward and drags one from off stump over mid-on. Very elegant, even slogging
text: good riposte! And he does look like a player who has a lot of shots when the ball is in his half of the pitch. Gets forward and drags one from off stump over mid-on. Very elegant, even slogging

commentary: Bracewell to Siriwardana, no run that time he has no answer to the fuller length, because it was tagged with a little bit of awayswing. Had to play, soundly beaten
text: that time he has no answer to the fuller length, because it was tagged with a little bit of awayswing. Had to play, soundly beaten

commentary: Bracewell to Siriwardana, 1 run dug in short, nice and tight on off stump too. New Zealand have been very accurate whenever they have gone for the short one. Siriwardana committed to pulling, and then had second thoughts. But that time the ball thudded into the face of the bat - he did not drop his wrists quick enough - and the ball just lobbed over midiwcket

commentary: McClenaghan to Siriwardana, no run lifter outside off, and Siriwardana is unequal to the challenge. Can't really fault him for that, just doff your hat to the bowler and move on

commentary: Bracewell to Kapugedera, 2 runs that's well done! Does not shy away from the short ball, despite it having caused so much problems. Swivelled on his back foot and pulls it behind square leg. The trick here was he got on top of the bounce

commentary: Bracewell to Kapugedera, FOUR runs smeared through extra cover. Kapugedera's timing has been very pleasing to watch. Saw the ball overpitched, and credit to him for being limber enough to stride forward despite the bouncer last ball

commentary: Bracewell to Kapugedera, 1 run whipped away to deep backward square leg with ease.

commentary: McClenaghan to Kapugedera, 1 run short ball, tucking him up, clipped through midwicket

commentary: McClenaghan to Siriwardana, OUT picks out point like a sharpshooter. Sri Lanka continue to sink, and its the short ball that's continuing to haunt them. Siriwardana is up on his tippy-toes and he crunches the ball away, but forgets about placement. A few yards either side and he would have beaten Nicholls and got a boundary

Siriwardana is up on his tippy-toes and he crunches the ball away, but forgets about placement. A few yards either side and he would have beaten Nicholls and got a boundary

commentary: McClenaghan to Kulasekara, no run fuller ball on off stump, defended
text: fuller ball on off stump, defended

commentary: McClenaghan to Kulasekara, no run short of a length, safely defused
text: short of a length, safely defused

commentary: McClenaghan to Kulasekara, no run

McClenaghan to Kulasekara, OUT absolute shocker! Kula and Kapu were at the same end, preparing to shake hands, and New Zealand were able to throw to the wrong end, recover and then hit the target at the right one. Back of a length ball was eased towards point, and Kula took a few steps down. Kapu responded and did not look back. Kalu did though, because Guptill at point moved quickly to his right to cut the angle. The throw misses the target at the batsman's end, but Nicholls backs up nicely at midiwcket and relays the ball to a man waiting at the bowler's end. There really was no single there.
text: absolute shocker! Kula and Kapu were at the same end, preparing to shake hands, and New Zealand were able to throw to the wrong end, recover and then hit the target at the right one. Back of a length ball was eased towards point, and Kula took a few steps down. Kapu responded and did not look back. Kalu did though, because Guptill at point moved quickly to his right to cut the angle. The throw misses the target at the batsman's end, but Nicholls backs up nicely at midiwcket and relays the ball to a man waiting at the bowler's end. There really was no single there.

commentary: Sodhi to Kulasekara, no run right in front. Kula plays for the turn, but Sodhi rarely gets the ball to move sideways. I think he is struck in line around off stump, and it was low enough for him to be lbw. But Kula goes for a review. No bat involved, which umpire Gough checks with both Hot Spot and Snicko. But ball-tracking saves Kula - has been struck outside the line. Well well well, that is certainly one heck of a review
text: right in front. Kula plays for the turn, but Sodhi rarely gets the ball to move sideways. I think he is struck in line around off stump, and it was low enough for him to be lbw. But Kula goes for a review. No bat involved, which umpire Gough checks with both Hot Spot and Snicko. But ball-tracking saves Kula - has been struck outside the line. Well well well, that is certainly one heck of a review

commentary: Sodhi to Chameera, OUT wild appeal from the keeper and the bowler, but I think there was daylight between bat and ball. Someone from the NZ cordon says, 'I heard something,' so stand-in captain Taylor goes for the review. This was a good length ball that does turn after pitching. Chameera was only half-forward as he goes to block. Hot Spot shows a mark on the edge and he has to go off. Another heck of review.

commentary: Henry to Kulasekara, OUT backs away and smashes a length ball right into the hands at short cover. Smart grab that from Latham, as he jumps up and takes it high over his head. That's all Sri Lanka have for you. The umpires check the front foot, he's fine. He's got another four-for.

commentary: Chameera to Guptill, FOUR runs chance, dropped and the chaos continues. Chameera starts off from around the wicket and digs the ball in short. He has the field for it and Guptill keeps them in play as he pulls feebly. Rushed by the pace, the ball ends up at leg gully. Siriwardana had to dive to his right, got two hands to it, and then it spilled out and went to the boundary

commentary: Kulasekara to Guptill, SIX runs he does not have the pace to bowl short and Guptill seemed to be waiting for it in that knowledge. Took a couple of steps down the track and launches it into the fans way beyond long-on. Didn't even look up, what a boss.

commentary: Kulasekara to Guptill, 1 leg bye walks across outside off and is struck low on the pad. Good, concerted appeal from Kula and I think he was in with a shout for lbw. Mathews goes for a review, very very late. The 15 second period had passed, but it seems like Sri Lanka have persuaded the on-field umps to still go for it. Fuller ball on middle and leg, Guptill went for an manufactured, agricultural heave and is safe because the ball was sliding down leg

commentary: Senanayake to Latham, 3 runs a touch short and wide, Latham cuts it behind point and the placement is good enough to get three

commentary: Senanayake to Guptill, 1 run nudged into the midwicket region to record the fastest ODI fifty by a New Zealander. Went off like a freight train against the short and length balls. Was given the luxury to do so by the small total. Very McCullum like, and it was his record that Guptill has taken over

commentary: Vandersay to Guptill, FOUR runs first ball in ODI cricket is a long hop, which Guptill muscles over the short fine leg. Pitching middle and leg, going on with the arm because there is not as much spin. Was close to the diving man at 45 degrees, but it was a very hard chance

commentary: Vandersay to Guptill, SIX runs gee, they are going to finish this before lunch! Picks up a length ball and pastes it into the grass banks beyond long-on. That's a 107 m monster

commentary: Vandersay to Guptill, SIX runs maybe he thought the off side boundary was feeling left out. Plants the front leg outside leg stump and plants the ball over the ropes at long-off
